intro: Lasiandra virgata, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Lasiandra virgata is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
